page.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc, or the sheet of paper itself
page.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The full address is given on page 15.
You will find the answers over the page.
We took out a full page advertisement in the ‘Village Voice’.
page.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: all the writing etc that you can see at one time on a computer screen
page.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a web page (=a single screen of writing, pictures etc on a website)
page.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a student or young person who works as a helper to a member of the US Congress
page.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a boy who served a knight during the Middle Ages as part of his training
page.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a boy who in the past served a person of high rank
page.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: the next/previous page
I glanced back to the previous page.
What’s on the next page?
the opposite/facing page
See the diagram on the opposite page.
the left-hand/right-hand page
The answers are on the right-hand page.
the front/back page
Her picture was on the front page of every newspaper.
the sports/arts/financial etc pages
He only ever reads the sports pages.
a blank page
There were a couple of blank pages at the back of the book.
a new/fresh page
Start each section of your essay on a new page.
a full page
The article went on for a full page.
turn a page
I turned the page in order to find out what happened next.
turn to/see page 22/45 etc
Turn to page 8 for more details.
flick/flip/leaf through the pages of something
She was flicking through the pages of a magazine.
jump/leap off the page
One mistake jumped off the page.
the top of the page
Write your name at the top of the page.
the bottom/foot of the page
See the note at the bottom of page 38.
page.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with page
page.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: I stared at the words on the page
page.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: Something is on the first/last/next etc page
The answer is on the next page
The answer is in the next page
page.translation[0].note_box[1].items[2]: There is a diagram on page 35
There is a diagram on the page 35
There is a diagram in page 35
page.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to call someone’s name out in a public place, especially using a loudspeaker, in order to find them
page.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She hurried to the reception desk and asked the girl to page her husband.
page.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to send a message to someone’s pager asking them to go somewhere or telephone someone
page.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He was constantly being paged during meetings.
page.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc, or the sheet of paper itself
page.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The sales figures are on page 15 of the report.
page.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: the pages in magazines, newspapers etc that are used to advertise goods and services
page.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Fortune magazine will show a 13% increase in ad pages for the first quarter.
page.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: the pages in magazines, newspapers etc that deal with business, sport etc
page.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The format could make 'The Wall Street Journal’s financial-markets pages easier to read.
page.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: the first page at the front of a newspaper, where the most important news is
page.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: The newspaper carried the item on its front page.
Mr. Guerin was profiled in a front-page story in the ‘FT’.
page.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: a piece of writing or pictures on a computer screen that will fill one side of a piece of paper when printed
page.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: Print Preview displays the layout of the pages you are about to print.
page.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: part of a website which you can see on a computer screen at any one time
page.translation[2].definitions[5].examp: A hit counter measures and displays the number of times visitors have viewed a single page on a website.
page.translation[2].definitions[6].defin: a message that you receive on a pager
page.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to contact someone, using a pager
page.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The customer is paged automatically every time a new fax or email arrives.
page.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to call someone’s name out in a public place, especially using a loudspeaker, in order to find them
page.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: You could try paging him over the public address system.
